displaytitle: Companions of Cadmus Devoured by Dragon
dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed inside plate): 25 × 31.7 cm (9 13/16 × 12 1/2 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase with funds given by David G. Carter, Class of 1945
markings:
Collector's stamp, verso lower left and center: Max Egon Fürst zu Fürstenberg (Lugt 995)

Watermark: possibly an escutcheon with fleur-de-lys on it
inscribed:
Four lines of Latin and date inscribed in plate, lower left corner: Hasce artis primitias CC Pictor inuent. / simulas HGoltz. sculpt …admiratori amictia ergo D D.   Ao 1588.

Printed below plate, from left to right: Dirus Agenorida laniat social agmina serpens, Vltor adest Cadmus paenasque reposcit ab hoste.

titles.title: Companions of Cadmus Devoured by Dragon

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

caption: Hendrick Goltzius (1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands), after Cornelis Cornelisz. van Haarlem (1562–1638; born and died Haarlem, Netherlands), Companions of Cadmus Devoured by Dragon, 1588.
